oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Church of the Lord Jesus Christ service, 1997 May 23
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hood, Ralph W.; Williamson, W. Paul (William Paul)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Video recording of a service opening with music. Lydia Hollins plays organ, Roy “Bootie” Christian and Billy Lemming play guitar. A pause in the music reveals a woman speaking in tongues. Glen Dukes asks the congregation to pray for an abducted girl’s safety. The film cuts to members praying at the pulpit and in their pews. Following the prayer, Billy Lemming plays guitar as Joel Sherbert sings. Lucille Church sings after Sherbert. As she sings, Bill Pelfrey handles several serpents. He hands one of these to Joel Sherbert. A few moments later Pelfrey hands his serpent to Dewey Chafin and removes another from the box for himself. John Wayne John Wayne "Punkin" Brown Jr. Jr. and Steve Porter also handle. Lydia Hollins sings as Steve Porter dances with a serpent in each hand before replacing them in their box. The music calms down and Carl Porter testifies before the music starts up again. Another lull allows John Wayne "Punkin" Brown Jr. to testify. During his testimony music plays and he sings. Lydia Hollins can be seen twirling. She falls to her knees and crawls to the pulpit to stand. Dewey Chafin continues to handle serpents, as do a multitude of others including Carl Porter, John Wayne "Punkin" Brown Jr., Larry Muncie, Rayford Dunn, and Kirby Hollins. The music ends and Carl Porter speaks to the congregation and testifies. When he has finished, two brothers who are visiting the church testify. Carl Porter invites Brother Dexter to the pulpit to testify. After his testimony he gives a sermon which is followed by animated dancing as music once again fills the church. As music plays, one man can be seen slain in spirit upon the floor as a female member of the church lays hands on an other member. There follows more dancing and a group of women surround a dancing woman as elders of the church lay hands on her. Spencer Evans and Joel Sherbert handle serpents again as do many others including Billy Lemming, Verlin Short, Diane Tucker, and Bill Pelfrey and his first wife. As this continues, other members have their heads anointed with oil. Several members testify after the music concludes and among them are Lydia Hollins, Kirby Hollins, Buddy Jewel, Roy “Bootie” Christian, Sally D. Hunt, and Lucille Church.
